upgrades.changelog:
* Includes firmware versions: 1.10, 1.20, 1.30, 1.40, 1.50, 1.60, 1.70, 1.80, 1.90
* This firmware version is compatible with hardware version 1.10 or 1.30 and higher. You can check your hardware version on the back of the ZEN52 module.
* Updated parameter names and short descriptions in the Configuration Command Class for improved clarity and consistency.
* Fixed an issue with LED behavior when the ZEN52 is included in a Z-Wave network — the LED now follows Parameter 1 settings as expected.
* Resolved a mechanical switch issue that occurred when firmware version 1.80 was flashed to hardware version 1.10. The mechanical switch now functions properly on both hardware versions.
* Bug Fix: Parameter 28 (DC Motor Mode) with value 2 now functions correctly when the ZEN52 is triggered using connected mechanical switches.

* Includes firmware versions: 1.10, 1.20, 1.30, 1.40, 1.50, 1.60, 1.70, 1.80, 1.90
* This firmware version is compatible with hardware version 1.10 or 1.30 and higher. You can check your hardware version on the back of the ZEN52 module.
* Updated parameter names and short descriptions in the Configuration Command Class for improved clarity and consistency.
* Fixed an issue with LED behavior when the ZEN52 is included in a Z-Wave network — the LED now follows Parameter 1 settings as expected.
* Resolved a mechanical switch issue that occurred when firmware version 1.80 was flashed to hardware version 1.10. The mechanical switch now functions properly on both hardware versions.
* Bug Fix: Parameter 28 (DC Motor Mode) with value 2 now functions correctly when the ZEN52 is triggered using connected mechanical switches.

* Includes firmware versions: 1.10, 1.20, 1.30, 1.40, 1.50, 1.60, 1.70
* Removed the delay when controlling the ZEN52 from the external mechanical switch when parameter 27 is set to value 0.
* Fixed bug: Both external switches can be triggered at the same time now.

* Includes firmware versions: 1.10, 1.20, 1.30, 1.40, 1.50, 1.60, 1.70
* Removed the delay when controlling the ZEN52 from the external mechanical switch when parameter 27 is set to value 0.
* Fixed bug: Both external switches can be triggered at the same time now.
